programme.title: Rupert Bear Ep9
programme.desc: Rupert and the Magic Lantern - Rupert, Edward and Bill go camping. Rupert is excited at the idea of playing explorers' but as darkness falls the friends are frightened by strange shadows and noises.

programme.title: Rupert Bear Ep10
programme.desc: Ruperts Treasure Hunt - Raggety is getting the wood tidy for the annual visit of the Spring Inspector. If it's not looking its best, Spring won't go ahead and Raggety needs help from Rupert and his friends

programme.title: Rupert Bear Ep11
programme.desc: Rupert Flies to Cheddar Moon - When Ping Pong uses her magic to turn Rupert's pedal car into a spaceship they fly to the moon. There they meet the Man on the Moon who runs a cheese stall.

programme.title: Rupert Bear Ep12
programme.desc: Rupert and the Giant Egg Race - It's the day of the Nutwood Egg and Spoon race but Raggety has magically turned Ping Pong into a giant egg. How can Ruprt and the friends have their race now?

programme.title: Guess with Jess Ep9
programme.desc: Why Do Spiders Build Webs? - The friends are having a tidying up day. Frightened Baa doesn't like spiders or their webs but Jess helps him to stop being scared by working out that Spiders build webs to catch their supper, and Baa feels re-assured and happy. Spiders are rather nice, rather clean and rather clever.

programme.title: Guess with Jess Ep10
programme.desc: How Can We Bring The Outside Inside? - Poor Willow has a sore hoof and has to stay inside until it's better. She's really missing her orchard so Jess and Mimi are determined to bring something of the outside to Willow to cheer her up. A tree is too big and it's too late in the year for apples. Jess works out that they can make beautiful tree and leaf rubbings into a wonderful tree collage for the stable to remind Willow of her orchard.

programme.title: Guess with Jess Ep11
programme.desc: What's My Favourite Thing About Spring? - Mimi has promised Jess a special surprise if he can work out what he likes best about the Spring He finds out that there's blossom on the trees, fresh new grass, bright young flowers in the Springtime. But he decides his very favorite thing is the newly hatched very cute little baby birds which his friend Little Bird has been singing about all along.

programme.title: Guess with Jess Ep12
programme.desc: How Can I Hide Without Being Found? - Willow is the best hide-and-seek finder! Jess is determined to work out a way of hiding without Willow finding him! A trip to the pond where he discovers that both Horace and Sammy Snail are camouflaged leads him to work out that he too can do the same to hide from Willow at last!

programme.title: Olivia Ep25
programme.desc: Olivia And The Family Photo - Mother is determined to take the perfect family Christmas photo in the middle of the summer. With the help of a snow machine, Olivia takes it upon herself to bring a little Christmas spirit to the photograph, and to Francine's backyard beach party next door.

programme.title: Olivia Ep26
programme.desc: Olivia Goes Camping - Francine comes along reluctantly on Olivia's family camping trip, and Olivia can't believe that anyone could be so unprepared for life in the great outdoors. But with a little hiking, bug-catching, and marshmallow roasting, Olivia is sure she can transform Francine from a novice to an expert camper.

programme.title: Olivia Ep27
programme.desc: Olivia The Nature Photographer - After snapping some great photos of her cat Edwin, Olivia thinks she's ready to photograph some real wild animals. She and Julian camp out in the backyard to wait for some, and sure enough they track down a mysterious animal in the bushes. But is it really a wild beast?

programme.title: Olivia Ep28
programme.desc: The Two Olivias - There's a new girl in Olivia's class and her name is...Olivia! Confusion ensues, and Olivia (the original Olivia) can't believe that she shares her name with another person. After a brief stint calling herself Pam, Olivia eventually decides that a two Olivia town might not be so bad after all.

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales Ep9
programme.desc: Why Monkeys Swing In The Trees - You see there was a time when Monkey used to play on the ground and he loved to wind up Crocodile. One day the Big Rains came and Monkey got stranded up the Mango Tree. Nasty Crocodile promised to take him to dry land. But only in exchange for one thing. His HEART! Monkey tricked Crocodile and when Crocodile found out that Monkey swapped his heart for a measley mango, he chased Monkey up a tree. From that day on Monkey swings in the trees keeping well clear of Crocodiles angry snaps! Tales from Africa.

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales Ep10
programme.desc: Why Tickbird Sits On Hippos Back - You see there was a time when Tickbird didn't sit on Hippo's back, infact they weren't friends at all! Tickbird was sick of Hippo splashing all the time. One day tiny Tickbird challenges big Hippo to a contest who can drink the most water in a single gulp! Tickbird outwits Hippo by using the tides and from that day she is allowed to sit on Hippo's back and pick off all the yummy ticks she can eat! Tales from Africa.

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales Ep11
programme.desc: Why Frog Croaks - You see there was a time when Frog didn't croak. Frog sang like a bird and the birds didn't like it. Birds were the masters of song and that's the way it should be! So the birds trick poor old Frog into a singing duel and sing and sing and sing until poor old Frog's voice is reduced to a rebbit. Tales from Africa.

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales Ep12
programme.desc: Why Spider Has A Tiny Waist - You see there was a time when Spider didn't have a tiny waist. She was all big and round and did she like her food! One day greedy Spider hears of Four Feasts in Tinga Tinga and she wanted to go to them all! So she spun four threads and attached them to various animals going to the feasts. But the Monkeys, Frog, Hippo and the Bees all set off in different directions North, South, East and West and Spider's thread soon runs out. EEeeek! The threads get tighter and tighter and tighter, making Spider's smaller and smaller and smaller! Luckily the threads break, but from that day on Spider has always had a tiny waist. Tales from Africa.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants Ep1
programme.desc: Captain Underpants and The Frenzied Farts of Flabby Flabulous - George and Harold create a comic book about their gym teacher, but after a freak accident turns fantasy into reality, the best friends must run from his revenge

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants Ep2
programme.desc: Captain Underpants and The Dreadful Debacle of DJ Drowsy Drawers - George and Harold attempt to save the fun at their school dance, but matters are made worse when their music teachers transforms into the dull yet deadly villain DJ Drowsy Drawers

programme.title: Boss Baby: Back in Business Ep37
programme.desc: Who's a Good Baby? - A brainwashed Boss Baby breaks free from overly sanitized Bubbeezee products. He rallies the Playgroup Babies to run the company out of business by breaking every product in town.

programme.title: Boss Baby: Back in Business Ep38
programme.desc: Yellow 100 - Finally promoted to CEO, Boss Baby sets his sights on achieving 100% Baby Love, while dealing with the annoying Puppies and Preeks who rented Baby Corp office space while Boss was gone. Tim and Danny become local heroes after saving a baby's life.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Dragon Knight Ep2
programme.desc: The Knights Code - Po and Blade's personalities clash as they track Klaus and Veruca and fight off some of Po's old foes. Blade gets to see Po's kung fu mastery, but doesn't agree to team up with him until she realizes that he accidentally holds the key to finding Klaus and Veruca: he has a piece of the WuGao Gauntlet. Meanwhile, Klaus and Veruca continue on their path of destruction while looking for the mysterious "Lotus".

programme.title: Trolls: The Beat Goes On! Ep52
programme.desc: Switcher-Ruby/Bye Bye Bunker - Poppy and Branch switch bodies, and learn to appreciate each others point of view. /When Branch decides its time for him to move out of the bunker, Poppy tries to be as supportive as she can, even though it seems Branch himself may have some doubts.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Puss In Boots Ep65
programme.desc: A Savage Place - After winning the trust of the Zephilim, Puss storms the Blind King's castle in hopes of saving his friends, restoring the true ruler of the Netherworld, and blocking the Portal for good

programme.title: Dawn Of The Croods Ep14
programme.desc: Gran The Unfriendly Ghost / Bad Sandy - Gran is sick of the Croods not listening to her advice and fakes her own death. But, when the Croods don't mourn to her liking, she haunts them/Ahhh! Valley threatens to exile Sandy after a string of bad behavior unless the Croods can get her under control

programme.title: Where's Wally? Ep40
programme.desc: Gibraltar ROCKS! - When Wally and Wenda head to WWS Great Magic Key Vault, located in Gibraltar, to find Whitebeard a key for his birthday, they find that Odlulu has already cleaned out the vault; the Wanderers must round up all these keys, and theyll have to do it in time for Whitebeards surprise birthday party.

programme.title: Go, Dog. Go! Ep25
programme.desc: The Pawston Chewbilee / Dont Go, Cat. Go! - Based on PD Eastman's classic childrens book, Go, Dog. Go! Follows 6-year-old dog, Tag Barker, on her hilarious adventures in the city of Pawston, a fun-loving community of dogs on the go. Tag is a skilled mechanic and loves anything that goes. With her ingenuity and creativity, Tag can go as far as any plan will take her, always with her best friend, Scooch Pooch, by her side. Scoochs easy-going nature is the perfect counterbalance to Tags high-octane energy. But as much as Tag loves to go, shes often reminded that it's family, friends and neighbors that really fuel a community.

programme.title: Team Zenko Go Ep13
programme.desc: Photo Day Disaster / The Eightful Eight - When Rodney heads to the Community Center for Junior Security Cadet picture day, TZG secretly helps him stay neat and clean for the photo shoot. / When Luis worries about his first ever math test, TZG secretly helps steady his nerves.

programme.title: Postman Pat: Special Delivery Service Ep25
programme.desc: Postman Pat's Pop Star Rescue - Everyone in Greendale is excited because pop superstar, Brad Lee is coming to Pencaster Bay to perform a concert. Unfortunately Brad's luxury private ship has broken down en route so Pat and Jess must head out to sea in the SDS boat and collect him. Meanwhile Julian, Meera, Bill and Sarah are on the train to Pencaster Bay with their mums to watch the concert. The kids enter into a cacophonous sing off' to decide who is the best singer. Pat and Jess collect Brad Lee from his ship only to find that he's afraid of small boats! Pat heads to shore as quickly as possible but unfortunately gets diverted to pick up a poorly puffin from Chris beacon at the lighthouse. Back at the Pencaster Bay the kids competitiveness leads to a dance off against the mums, who do surprisingly well. Pat finally manages to get the poorly puffin ashore to be treated by Amy the vet and Brad Lee goes on to perform a blistering concert by the seaside!

programme.title: Postman Pat: Special Delivery Service Ep26
programme.desc: Postman Pat And The Very Important Person - PC Selby is being honoured with a medal for being Best local Policeman of the year and Pat is despatched to Pencaster bay to collect both the medal and the person who is going to present it; The Duchess of Pencaster! Somewhat star struck Pat and Jess drive the Duchess towards Pencaster back to the award ceremony at Greendale but at her request they stop to help some of the villagers which unfortunately leads to her getting covered in coal dust and mud! PC Selby is also on his way to Greendale and also finds people in need of help and his best uniform is soon torn and covered in paint and compost! The Duchess and PC Selby meet and wonder quite how they are going to explain their tattered appearance to the crowd at the award ceremony. Luckily Pat explains how both PC Selby and The Duchess put helping others before themselves. Special delivery service mission accomplished!

programme.title: Dragons: Rescue Riders Ep13
programme.desc: Grumblegard, Part 1 - While the others care for baby dragons at the roost, Dak, Winger, Burple and Aggro come face-to-face with a grumpy old dragon on a dangerous island.

programme.title: Archibald's Next Big Thing Ep13
programme.desc: The Primrose Classic / The Blimpateers - A professional paper airplane thrower hires Archibald to be his caddie. While floating through the sky, Archibald bumps into birds who live in a blimp.

programme.title: All Hail King Julien Ep13
programme.desc: Crimson And Clover - Clover's wild, party-girl twin sister Crimson visits and King Julien is instantly smitten.

programme.title: Spirit Riding Free Ep32
programme.desc: Lucky and the Ghostly Gotcha! - When Snips claims not to be afraid of ghosts, the PALs decide to give him a fun Halloween scare hell never forget!

programme.title: Harvey Girls Forever! Ep26
programme.desc: That Thing You Dot / Where the Streets Have No Games - When Chevron bosses around everyone in her band, Dot decide to form her own band. The Harvey Street Kids become obsessed with a new video game.

programme.title: Turbo F.A.S.T. Ep26
programme.desc: Tur-Bros / The Snailman - During a visit to a racing convention Turbo is kidnapped by an overzealous fan and it's up to the rest of the FAST crew to save him. // Turbo throws a wild race for his fellow insects, but is surprised when his old nemesis, Guy Gagne, returns for a rematch.

programme.title: Guess with Jess Ep13
programme.desc: Why Do Bees Make Honey? - Mimi's munching some honey sandwiches at the Hutch when Jess comes to visit. She shows him the lovely pots of honey she has and he wonders why bees need to make it. He thinks maybe Jess wonders if it might be used as glue but when Horace singing him a groovy song about HOW honey is made, Jess has an idea that it might be used as food during the winter when there's no pollen..

programme.title: Guess with Jess Ep14
programme.desc: When Will The Owl Go Hooooo!? - Jess is excited to tell the children at home all about the Owl he heard Hoo Hoo'ing in the night and he wants to let us hear it. He tries everything he can think of to get the Owl to hoot until he works out that it was nightime when he last heard the owl, so it he waits til it's night again we might just all get to hear the lovely sound of the Owl.

programme.desc: Fast Feud / Never Friending Story - Ronnie Anne and Sid try to take down the obnoxious burger restaurant that opened up across the street. // After picking Par as his new best friend, Bobby realizes he may be in over his head.

programme.desc: Midnight Snack Attack / Hot Pearl-tato - After SpongeBob and Patrick eat a secret snack experiment, Plankton must reverse the monstrous side effects. // Mr. Krabs needs to find a babysitter for little Pearl, but she proves too much for the campers to handle.

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show S01 Ep106
programme.desc: Gas Station Vacation / Bunny the Barbarian - The Star Family heads to their favorite resort. // Bunny goes on a mid-day adventure to a forgotten age.

programme.desc: Bye, Bye, Birthday - Tired of the yearly cheer surrounding her birthday, Lucy casts a spell so her family will forget what day it is.

programme.desc: Friended! with the Casagrandes - Ronnie Anne makes friends with Sid, a girl whose family wants to rent the apartment upstairs. When it looks like another couple might get it first, the girls resort to sabotage to try and dissuade them.

programme.desc: Mustard O' Mine - When The Krusty Krab runs out of mustard, Mr. Krabs sends SpongeBob, Patrick and Squidward to dig up some more!

programme.title: The Casagrandes S02 Ep214
programme.desc: Zoo-mergency! - After a zoo fundraiser goes wrong, Sid must save the day with her family!

programme.title: Q+A Ep34
programme.desc: Sr. 16 - The show that holds newsmakers and leaders to account. Q+A brings you lively debate and unpredictable moments as Patricia Karvelas puts your questions to the panel to get you answers on the issues that matter to Australians.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent Ep24
programme.desc: We are your passport to the world. Our stories, told through the ABC's network of foreign correspondents, take you to incredible places where you'll meet the people and see the forces shaping our world. (Final for 2023)

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing Ep187
programme.desc: The daily destination for #auspol addicts. Greg Jennett comes to you from Parliament House with the latest news in politics and national affairs, plus interviews with key players on the issues and events making headlines.

programme.title: ABC News with Joe O'Brien Ep207
programme.desc: Joe O'Brien brings you a comprehensive summary of the day's events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on what's going on.

programme.title: The Drum Ep192
programme.desc: Conversations on the issues you care about. The Drum makes an impact in people's daily lives, encouraging thoughtful, challenging debate with a diverse panel led by Ellen Fanning, Dan Bourchier, Julia Baird and John Barron.

programme.title: ABC National News Ep207
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and the day's stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Joe O'Brien.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep162
programme.desc: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight Ep207
programme.desc: More news, more often: the home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the issues that matter. The ABC's network of reporters uncover important stories and bring you news and information you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The Business Ep150
programme.desc: Australia's leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News Ep207
programme.desc: Stay in touch with the latest breaking news and comprehensive coverage of the day's top stories. With reporters in more places, ABC News connects communities and tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: Four Corners Ep38
programme.desc: The longest running show on Australian TV, this award-winning current affairs documentary series is a powerhouse of investigative journalism - fearless and forensic, holding power to account through six decades and counting.

programme.title: The World Ep207
programme.desc: Know what's going on in our world. Beverley O'Connor presents the latest international news and a complete look at today's events with reports from ABC News correspondents and interviews with experts, commentators and guests.

programme.title: Australia Remastered: Desert - Desert Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Australia is the driest inhabited continent on earth, with 70% of the land mass declared an arid zone. Spanning five million square kilometres, this zone is one of the most exposed areas on the planet.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep162
programme.desc: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep207
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the day's events, explaining what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Jade Barker.

programme.title: Media Watch Ep37
programme.desc: Everybody loves it until they're on it! Australia's leading forum for media analysis and comment, bringing you a fearless critique of the week's journalism, issues and events in the news. Presented by Paul Barry.

programme.title: Secrets Of Our Cities - Bondi Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - In Bondi, Greig Pickhaver travels to the iconic Australian beach suburb. Bondi has welcomed Jewish migrants ever since Australia's first Jewish free settler built the first house in Bondi in the 1830s.

programme.title: The World Ep207
programme.desc: Know what's going on in our world. Beverley O'Connor presents the latest international news and a complete look at today's events with reports from ABC News correspondents and interviews with experts, commentators and guests.

programme.title: ABC Late News Ep207
programme.desc: Know the latest on the day's top stories, as Jade Barker brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: The Business Ep150
programme.desc: Australia's leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep162
programme.desc: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: The Drum Ep192
programme.desc: Conversations on the issues you care about. The Drum makes an impact in people's daily lives, encouraging thoughtful, challenging debate with a diverse panel led by Ellen Fanning, Dan Bourchier, Julia Baird and John Barron.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep18
programme.desc: Sr. 34 - Costa gives a lesson on landscaping, Tammy visits an orchid wonderland, Josh learns about legumes and nitrogen; Jane tours an edible forest, and we meet a gardener growing a fulfilling career in Canberra.

programme.title: News Breakfast Ep208

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Dawson vs. Green

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Yusuff vs. Barboza
programme.desc: Prelims - An elite featherweight talent readying his assault on the Top 10 at 145 pounds, Sodiq Yusuff has one more roadblock in his way in the form of feared striker Edson Barboza, who he meets in the October 14 main event of UFC Fight Night at the APEX in Las Vegas. Capable of ending a fight with one punch, kick, elbow or knee, Brazils Barboza is coming off a memorable knockout of Billy Quarantillo in April, and he has similar plans for Yusuff, whose back-to-back wins over Alex Caceres and Don Shainis have him in prime form.
